SEARCH
Package GameEngine

Class Renderer

java.lang.Object
GameEngine.Renderer
public class Renderer extends Object
Singleton class responsible for rendering a shape to the screen. The class also renders RenderData, which provides the renderer with information as to how to render a shape, such as colour, or if the shape should be filled or not. TerminalColour is the colour for when rendering with the terminal, in a textual manner. It's completely optional, since some terminals don't interpret the ANSI color codes. Color is the color for when rendering graphically. It's also optional, having a default color for when a color is null. Overlays are rendered differently, being overlayed on top of the raster after all the rasterization was completed.
See Also:
  • Scene
  • RenderData
  • IOverlay
  • IRenderable
  • IGeometricShape
  • GraphicWindow

    • init

      public void init(Rectangle camera, char backgroundChar)
      Initializes the Renderer. If the renderer had already been initialized, the settings are overwritten.
      Parameters:
      camera - the location to render
      backgroundChar - the default character to render where there is nothing to render.

      Parameters:

      camera - the location in space to render
      backgroundChar - the background character
      Throws:

    • render

      public void render(Circle circle, char drawChar, TerminalColour.Foreground terminalColour, Color graphicalColor) throws GameEngineException
      Renders a circle to the screen with colour.
      Parameters:
      circle - the circle to render
      drawChar - the character to render the circle with
      terminalColour - the colour to render the circle with in the terminal (can be null)
      graphicalColor - the colour to render the circle with in the graphical interface (can be null)
      Throws:
      GameEngineException - if the renderer was not initialized properly
